title: Intermediate English 301
headline: This free online English course identifies words about living abroad and enhances grammar skills and reading ability.
description: This English course focuses on vocabulary associated with eating and living abroad in foreign countries. After studying these new words, you'll brush up on your grammatical skills by exploring topics such as 'degrees of certainty' and 'intensifier adverbs.' Then, you'll learn about the numerous ways to use the term 'use to.' This course is a must-take to strengthen your progress and improve your foundational English skills.
courseDescription:
This English course aims to continue your learning progress in this global language. The first section will expand your vocabulary by exploring living abroad and international cuisines. Then, you will read articles, watch videos and listen to audio clips to help you understand more about overseas life situations. Afterward, you'll use the vocabulary you learned about living abroad in the grammar topics.

The grammar topics explore different modals and adverbs of degrees of certainty. It will also examine various intensifiers such as 'so,' 'such,' 'too,' and 'enough.' You will learn when and how to use 'used to' in positive and negative sentences as well as questions.

The last part of the course will enhance your English reading, speaking, and writing skills. In the 'Resource' section, you can find a writing activity to download and use to put what you've learned into practice. In addition, you will understand more about what you can do when moving and living abroad and how to deal with culture shock and homesickness.
